results.title: Carpark
results.brief_description: Moorabbin - The shopping mall is now a permanent fixture of our suburban landscapes. Carpark consists of multiple scenes of shopping, parking and just hanging-out juxtaposed against an aural collage of people talking about their experience of mall culture. This is a superbly crafted short experimental work that will resonate with each and every one of us who has spent time ‘down at the Mall’. Carpark was made over a weekend in the carpark of Southland shopping centre.

results.title: Carp in a marsh
results.brief_description: Uses natural sound and close-up photography to illustrate the mating of carp, fertilization of the eggs and the hatching of baby fish. Follows the smaller fish in their struggle for survival. No narration.

results.title: Caroms
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Crystal Gandrud
results.brief_description: Animation is used to exhibit the relationship between a carom an a reflection. This principle is used to solve elementary geometric inequalities, and to explore Fagano’s problem: To find a triangle of minimum perimeter that can be inscribed in a given acute-angled triangle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Caroline Chisholm: the emigrant's friend
results.brief_description: This incredibly energetic and intelligent woman stands out as one of the few women who have been recognised throughout Australia’s history. She was called a saint in her own lifetime. Caroline Chisholm pioneered migrant welfare and helped the most disadvantaged groups of all; the women and children, the poor and uneducated, the ignorant and the persecuted. She achieved more in her lifetime than almost anyone else in our history.

results.title: Carolin and the Frog
results.brief_description: Fact meets fantasy in the forests of East Gippsland. Carolin is a city kid; she doesn’t like the bush. Her parents are excited about their holiday in East Gippsland but to Carolin it spells dirt, insects and discomfort…until she encounters a frog! She rushes into the bush to find her voice and discovers the enchantment of the forest. Deals with the flora and fauna of East Gippsland and explores the meaning of wilderness.

results.title: Carnivorous plants
results.brief_description: Shows the unusual structure and behaviour of the Venus Flytrap, Trumpet Plant, Cobra Plant, Pitcher Plant, Sundew Plant and Utricularia, which are all species of carnivorous plants. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Carnivore capers
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Mark Laughlin
results.brief_description: This program set in the Royal Melbourne Zoo looks at three types of carnivores - lions, cape hunting dogs and seals, and follows the keeper through a typical day.

results.title: Carnarvon
results.brief_description: Aboriginals of central Queensland left cave paintings and rock engravings in the caves of the Carnarvon ranges. Today the Aboriginals are gone and the true meanings of the many unique designs may never be known.
results.description: Aboriginals of central Queensland left cave paintings and rock engravings in the caves of the Carnarvon ranges. Today the Aboriginals are gone and the true meanings of the many unique designs may never be known.

results.title: Carmen
results.creator_credit: Carl Koch, Primrose Productions and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: This film is one of Lotte Reiniger’s early films which can be described as a short pastiche on the opera story, in black and white silhouettes. The story is about Carmen, who entices the soldier Don Jose to the gypsy encampment where she steals his clothes. Disgraced and ashamed, Don Jose follows Carmen to a bullfight, but she escapes into the bullring and is carried triumphantly around the ring on the back of the bull. Designed and animated by Lotte Reiniger with music by Bizet.
